intro: Rayjacksonia annua, commonly known as the annual rayjacksonia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. The plant typically blooms during the rainy season, relying on seasonal rainfall for optimal growth. It has narrow, linear leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Rayjacksonia annua is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and open fields.
